founders.name: Dr Emma Williams
founders.background_summary: Dr Emma Williams is a highly experienced professional in dementia care, with over 27 years in the field and a PhD in Psychology from Bangor University. She is the founder of EmWill Care, a venture focused on revolutionising dementia care by integrating behavioural science with smart technology. Her primary solution, 'Less Distress,' is a behavioural tool designed to empower caregivers to predict and prevent distressed behaviours in individuals with dementia, aiming to reduce reliance on crisis-driven care and antipsychotic medications. Dr Williams is currently participating in accelerator programs with the Alzheimer's Society and Business Wales, indicating external validation and support for her venture. Her leadership experience includes founding EmWill Care and PACT (Positive Ageing Consultancy & Training), as well as serving as Director of Training for North Wales Regional Partnership Board and providing bespoke behavioural consultancy. These roles highlight her deep expertise and commitment to improving dementia care practices.

previous_companies.description: Founded and led a consultancy focused on positive ageing and training for dementia care.
Director of Training, responsible for developing and delivering training programs for dementia care professionals.
Provided bespoke behavioural consultancy for social care services, focusing on dementia care.

investment_criteria_assessment.assessment_summary: Dr Emma Williams is a highly credible founder with deep expertise in dementia care, a PhD in Psychology, and a track record of founding relevant ventures (PACT, EmWill Care). Her current work integrates behavioural science and technology to address a critical problem in healthcare, aligning strongly with impact-driven and tech-focused investment criteria. She has impressive leadership and consultancy experience, and her participation in accelerator programs further validates her strategic approach and potential.
